alert.note: Alert for Lake (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 9:27AM CDT until August 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Dyer, Gibson, Lake and Obion. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 927 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Troy, Kenton, Obion, Clayton, Trimble, Hornbeak, Samburg, Wolverine, Glass, Fremont, Roneys Store, Moffatt, Mason Hall, Spout Springs, Walnut Log, Grays Camp and Reelfoot National Wildlife Refuge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
